metadata.title: CVE-2021-47538 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: rxrpc:Fix rxrpc_local leak in rxrpc_lookup_peer() Need to call rxrpc_put_local()for peer candidate before kfree() as it holds a ref to rxrpc_local. [DH:v2: Changed to abstract the peer freeing code out into a function]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
